Sentencas: Incorporating mixed oxygen-ion-electron conducting (MIEC) cathode materials is a promising strategy to make intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs) viable; however, a lack of fundamental understanding of oxygen transport in these materials limits their development.
Titulo: Ab Initio DFT plus U Analysis of Oxygen Vacancy Formation and Migration in La1-xSrxFeO3-δ (x=0, 0.25, 0.50)

Sentencas: Density functional theory plus U (DFT+U) calculations are used to investigate how the Sr concentration affects the processes that govern oxygen ion transport in La1-xSrxFeO3-delta (LSF, x = 0, 0.25, and 0.50).
Titulo: Ab Initio DFT plus U Analysis of Oxygen Vacancy Formation and Migration in La1-xSrxFeO3-δ (x=0, 0.25, 0.50)

Sentencas: Specifically, we show that oxygen vacancies compensate holes introduced by Sr and that this compensation facilitates oxygen vacancy formation in LSF.
Titulo: Ab Initio DFT plus U Analysis of Oxygen Vacancy Formation and Migration in La1-xSrxFeO3-δ (x=0, 0.25, 0.50)

Sentencas: We also find that oxygen migration in LaFeO3 is accompanied by electron transfer in the opposite direction.
Titulo: Ab Initio DFT plus U Analysis of Oxygen Vacancy Formation and Migration in La1-xSrxFeO3-δ (x=0, 0.25, 0.50)

Sentencas: Our results explicitly identify and clarify the role of electron-deficient substitutions in promoting oxygen diffusion in LSF.
Titulo: Ab Initio DFT plus U Analysis of Oxygen Vacancy Formation and Migration in La1-xSrxFeO3-δ (x=0, 0.25, 0.50)

Sentencas: This atomic level insight is important for enabling rational design of iron-based SOFC cathode materials.
Titulo: Ab Initio DFT plus U Analysis of Oxygen Vacancy Formation and Migration in La1-xSrxFeO3-δ (x=0, 0.25, 0.50)
